text: Paul Langerhans (25 July 1847 â€“ 20 July 1888) was a German pathologist, physiologist and biologist. He was credited with the discovery of the cells that secrete insulin. The cells were named after him as the islets of Langerhans. ==References== Category:1847 births Category:1888 deaths Category:German physiologists Category:German biologists Category:Pathologists
title: Paul Langerhans
